holidays.name: Lazy Day
holidays.description: A holiday dedicated to doing absolutely nothing and embracing the pure joy of laziness.
holidays.origin: While no official proclamation exists, Lazy Day has been celebrated informally since the late 20th century as a quirky reminder to slow down and relax.
holidays.funFact: Lazy Day encourages people to nap guilt-free — studies say regular naps can boost creativity and productivity!

holidays.name: S'mores Day
holidays.description: A delicious day to celebrate the campfire treat made of toasted marshmallows, chocolate, and graham crackers.
holidays.origin: S'mores have been a beloved American campfire snack since at least the 1920s; August 10 is unofficially dedicated to enjoying this gooey delight.
holidays.funFact: The first published s'mores recipe appeared in a 1927 Girl Scouts manual titled 'Tramping and Trailing with the Girl Scouts.'

holidays.name: National Spoil Your Dog Day
holidays.description: A day to shower your furry best friend with treats, toys, belly rubs, and lots of love!
holidays.origin: Emerging from pet lovers' communities, this day encourages spoiling dogs to strengthen bonds and celebrate their companionship.
holidays.funFact: Many pet owners celebrate by baking homemade dog treats or organizing doggie playdates.

holidays.name: Duran Duran Appreciation Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the iconic British new wave band known for hits like 'Hungry Like the Wolf' and their stylish music videos.
holidays.origin: Fans around the world unofficially recognize August 10 as a day to honor Duran Duran’s influence on pop and fashion since the 1980s.
holidays.funFact: Duran Duran was one of the first bands to embrace the music video medium, helping MTV become a cultural phenomenon.
